author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Unsane’ Review: Who’s Running the Asylum?
text: People have a stilted way of talking in “Unsane,” and sometimes they seem to have huge hands. Both of these oddities are intentional. Steven Soderbergh’s paranoid thriller riffs on, and celebrates, genre gems of an earlier era, when characters on screen emitted dialogue that barely resembled everyday street talk. And Mr. Soderbergh, who loves to experiment and often serves as his own cinematographer, shot this spare, chilly feature on an iPhone 7 Plus, with auxiliary optics ranging from telephoto to extreme wide angle. His wide-angle lens suggests a sense of unhingement, if not flat-out unsanity, by magnifying everything...
